intro: Phacelia magellanica f. leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leaf phacelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, often hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its white-variegated leaves are a distinguishing feature of this particular form. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
